title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5321.10 - Remote system access
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5321.10 - Remote system access

State Regulations
(a) In emergency
situations or as an element of technical support, an employee of a licensed
casino vendor enterprise may perform analysis of, or render technical support
with regard to, a gaming facility licensee's slot-monitoring system, casino-management system, player-tracking system, gaming-voucher system or
other commission-approved system from a remote location. (b) In addition to the requirements set forth
in section
5313.1
of this Subchapter, a gaming
facility licensee shall establish a system of internal controls applicable to
remote-system access. The internal control procedures submitted by the gaming
facility licensee shall be designed to protect the physical integrity of the
systems and related data and be capable of limiting the remote access to the
system or systems requiring technical support. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
5321.10

Adopted

New

York State Register November 16, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 46, eff. 11/16/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
